channel.title: Macintosh
channel.description: Is there a way to get moparscape private server running on a mac?When I try to open the .jar file it makes an error. Im running mac OS 10.3.9.

item.title: Macintosh
item.dc:creator: @byte byte
item.description:
@byte wrote:

Assuming you have mac os x 10.4, I'm presuming you have the default 1.4 release. You can download the 1.5 release here.

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/java2se50release1.html

Read full topic

item.title: Macintosh
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ZNRUNE:

I'll try it. :o[br][size=1]Posted at: April 10, 2006, 10:38:48 am[/size][hr]Hey, i looked into it more and it won't work because it needs files that won't execute on a mac. A mac version would be really cool ut it's a ton of work.[br][size=1]Posted at: April 10, 2006, 07:19:03 pm[/size][hr]If I had the source code for mopar privserver I could along with help from someone in my family port it to osx. Is moparscape open source?[br][size=1]Posted at: April 10, 2006, 07:29:39 pm[/size][hr]bump

dont bump, Ill get around to it

but java will work on a mac, I dont use any jni or anything not compatible with moparscape, so if you can play runescape then you can play moparscape, what exactly is it saying?

Read full topic

item.title: Macintosh
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ZNRUNE:

When I download the Private server or the Client I get a .zip file. No .rar to be found. The .jar file doesn't launch either. I get an an error message and the console shows:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bot (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:123)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:251)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:55)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:194)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:274)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)

I just updated JAVA today.

see how it says unsupported version? that means you need the latest java, whether you just updated today or not

Read full topic

item.title: Macintosh
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ZNRUNE:

Ya, Sorry, I am referring to moparscape. I opened it in JAVA studio creator but there doesn't seem to be a file to run.

you need to download winrar, from the link jme_009 gave you, then extract the .rar into its own folder, and assuming you have java installed you should be able to double click mopar.jar and have it run

Read full topic

item.title: Macintosh
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I would assume he is talking about moparscape, but java is cross platform.

On second thought, maybe he wants to know how to open a .rar file? In that case you need winrar: http://www.rarlab.com/download.htm
